title: Speed of the block after traveling distance x

content.description: Blocks <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, each of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, are connected by a string that extends over a pulley. Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> slides on a horizontal surface, and Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is on a surface that is inclined at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the horizontal, as shown. Both surfaces have negligible friction. The masses of the string and pulley are negligible, and the pulley rotates with negligible friction.
content.question: The system is released from rest. Which of the following is a correct expression for the speed of Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when it has moved a distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of g x, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of, g x times the sine of theta, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mi>g</mi><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.10em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the square root of, 2 g x times the sine of theta, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.10em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the square root of, g x times, open parenthesis, 1 plus the sine of theta, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mi>g</mi><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the square root of, 2 g x times, open parenthesis, 1 plus the sine of theta, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of, g x times the sine of theta, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mi>g</mi><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.10em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi></msqrt></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
